attributes.action: Give working parents extra annual leave and suppor to cover school holidays
attributes.additional_details:
Working parents on average get 20-30 working days off a year as annual leave.  The school holidays total on average 72 working days.  How are parents who do not have extended family or cannot afford childcare expected to look after their children if they do not have the leave to cover it? 

Many working families do not have disposable income and cannot afford to pay a minimum £200 a week per child for summer holiday clubs
attributes.background:
The Government must:
- fund and require employers to provied additional paid leave to cover school holidays
- fund free holiday clubs for all working parents 
- fund paid special leave for parents for when their child is sick to enable them to retain their annual leave
